verbose_text: On the other hand, activation of specific signaling proteins such as c-Jun-N-terminal kinase (JNK), p38 mitogen activated protein kinase (MAPK), and AMP activated protein kinase (AMPK) and/or transcription factors such as nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB), activator protein-1, p53, and Foxo lead to the loss of skeletal muscle mass through augmenting the activity of ubiquitin-proteasome system (UPS), autophagy, and caspases [XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR].
